Dialogue.Line: Now, Ambassador, we have work to do. There are several matters I wish to discuss with you concerning the future administration of this planet on more efficient lines. I shall require your help.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor regains consciousness and slowly gets to his feet. He looks at the smoking remains of the lance then glances around for Ettis before running off down the tunnels.
The Doctor sits down for a rest.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor.
Gebek.
Oh, I was just on my way to find you. Well, did you manage to stop him?
Well, something did. The whole gun blew up.
Thank goodness for that. But, er, what happened to Ettis?
I'm afraid he's dead. How are thing's going?

Oh, not too well. We drove the Ice Warriors out of the mines but we couldn't break through to the Citadel. Now the temperature dropping, soon they'll be able to come in after us. And worse than that, the air's getting stale.
Yes, I've noticed. Well, they probably switched the ventilation system off.
We'll be gradually forced up to the upper levels. There are Ice Warriors waiting at every exit.
Where's the ventilation controlled from, do you know?
Yes, the refinery.
Well, you'd better take me there straight away. And by the way, where's Sarah? Well, answer me, man. Where is she?
I left her looking after Rima, Doctor, but when I went back for her, he was dead. She was gone.
What?
I'm sorry.
Well, it's not your fault, is it. Now don't worry, old chap, we'll find her.
We will never forget him, Sarah. He was a true friend to Peladon. His name will always be honoured.
I still can't believe it. I can't believe that he's dead. You see, he was the most alive person I ever met.
Well, perhaps he escaped somehow? There's always a chance.
That's what the Doctor used to say. There's always a chance, that while there's life

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Alpha enters.

Dialogue.Line: Your Majesty! I have just had an exhausting meeting with Commander Azaxyr, discussing his plans for his future rule of this planet.
His rule? Queen Thalira rules Peladon.
In name only from now on. Azaxyr plans an extension of martial law over the entire planet. All able-bodied citizens will be conscripted to work in the trisilicate mines.
My people will never submit to this!
I fear your people will have little choice, your Majesty.
But surely the Federation won't approve?
Then it's up to us to get a message to the Federation and tell them what Azaxyr is up to.
I've already tried that. Azaxyr has blocked all the communications circuits. I could activate the spatial distress beacon but it only sends a signal on a pre-set frequency. A general call for help.
A kind of SOS? Well, let's try it. Was the communications room guarded when you left?
No, it was empty.
Then all we've got to do is get there. But how?
There is the secret passage behind the throne.
In full view of the guard?
We've got to get past him.
If we could entice him from the doorway, he's far too slow to prevent our escaping.
Our escaping, your Majesty?
Yes, Ortron. We intend to join our people in the mines.
Your Majesty, I forbid it!
What would you have me do, Orton? Stay here to become a puppet queen for Commander Azaxyr? See my people made slaves?
Your Majesty, you put me to shame. We shall assist you in your escape.
Well, the first thing we need to do is create a diversion. Your Majesty, do you think you could faint convincingly?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Alpha comes out of the Throne room and goes up to the Ice Warrior on guard.

Dialogue.Line: The Queen is ill.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Through the doorway, Thalira can be seen lying on the steps to the throne.

Dialogue.Line: You must summon medical assistance immediately.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sarah beckons the Ice Warrior in. Alpha waits outside the door. When the Warrior gets to the steps, Sarah pushes him.

Dialogue.Line: Run, everybody!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Thalira screams. The Ice Warrior is standing on her cloak and she is trapped.

Dialogue.Line: Your Majesty!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Ortron pulls the Ice Warrior away.

Dialogue.Line: Run, your Majesty!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Ice Warrior kills Ortron.

Dialogue.Line: Ortron!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Thalira turns back. The Ice Warrior points his weapon at her.

Dialogue.Line: No! The Ambassador and the Doctor's companion, where are they?
They went to tunnels. They wanted to join Gebek and the rebels.
How very convenient. Let there be no more of this foolishness, your Majesty. You can see for yourself the results of defying the Ice Warriors. Guard her.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Thalira drapes her cloak over her dead Chancellor.
Gebek leads the Doctor through the tunnels, avoiding Ice Warriors. They arrive outside the refinery, and hide when Azaxyr arrives, behaving furtively. He enters, followed by an Ice Warrior.

Dialogue.Line: Good. You have switched off the ventilation system.
Yes, it won't be long now.
Excellent. The Ambassador and the Doctor's companion have foolishly taken refuge in the mines.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The refinery door is slightly open. Gebek and the Doctor are outside, listening.

Dialogue.Line: Come on, we haven't much time.
I am trying to remember the correct circuit.
Oh, hurry up.
Please? You are making me nervous.
Oh, er, sorry. I'll let you concentrate. I'll check what's going on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sarah flicks through the various CCTV channels on the monitor. She discovers Eckersley and Azaxyr talking in the refinery.

Dialogue.Line: It is done. Though of course there is no guarantee that anyone will hear it, or that they will act on it if they do.
Look at this.
It's Eckersley and Commander Azaxyr.

Oh, I know that. Bit chummy though, aren't they? As if they were. Can you get me sound on this? AZAXYR [on monitor]: Yes, but I see no further need for this masquerade, Eckersley. ECKERSLEY [on monitor]: Well, I do. We agreed. Till we succeeded, I stay undercover. AZAXYR [on monitor]: But this planet is almost ours. ECKERSLEY [on monitor]: Almost isn't quite good enough. Things could still go wrong, and if they do, well, I'm just an innocent bystander. AZAXYR [on monitor]: Very well. Just so long as we can soon begin shipping trisilicate to Galaxy Five.
They are both traitors!
They've agreed our terms.
Subject to a time limit, so we must conclude matters quickly.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor and Gebek hear everything.

Dialogue.Line: Well, I'm ready to get things moving. How soon can you regain control of the mines?
Air will run out eventually, and then they must come up.
Yes, but that will take time.
And time is short.
Then we'll smoke them out with Aggedor.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Eckersley pulls a tapestry aside to reveal a stone statue.

Dialogue.Line: That'll get them on the move.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Eckersley operates switches and levers on a control panel. The statue vanishes and reappears in a mine tunnel near a group of miners. They panic and run, but one gets killed. The statue reappears in the refinery.

Dialogue.Line: (silent) Stay there.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor goes to the other side of the door.

Dialogue.Line: It seems the Doctor was right. The appearances of Aggedor were a technological trick, controlled by Eckersley. But why has he been doing this?
Well, it's obvious, isn't it? He was deliberately making things worse so he could persuade you to call in his Ice Warrior friends. Look!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A silver haired man is peering through the slightly open doorway.

Dialogue.Line: Ambassador, look. Look, it's the Doctor!
What?
He's alive. He's alive after all! You stay here and keep sending that SOS call. I'm going to join him.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sskel is reporting in over the intercom.

Dialogue.Line: The miners are fleeing from the lower levels. We are destroying them as they emerge.
See that all exits are blocked. They must not escape.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor peers round the door to look at the statue, then leaves.

Dialogue.Line: It seems that our scheme is working, Eckersley.
I'd better keep up the good work then.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Eckersley sends the statue into the tunnels again. This time it kills a pair of guards.

Dialogue.Line: What's happening, Doctor?
I'm afraid that it's Eckersley that has been summoning up Aggedor. And now he's using him to attack your miners.
Well, we must stop him!
No. If we show our faces in there, Azaxyr will wipe us out without a qualm. I'm sorry, Gebek. We've got to wait our chance.
Well, that should do for the moment. Give them another dose later.
Excellent. Let us return to the Citadel.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor and Gebek hide.

Dialogue.Line: You have reset the alarm?
I can't, not from here. The late, lamented Doctor jiggered the control circuits. I'll have to reset the alarm from the communications room.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Eckersley leaves. Azaxyr speaks to the Ice Warrior.

Dialogue.Line: Guard the refinery.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Azaxyr leaves. The Doctor and Gebek whisper behind the rock.

Dialogue.Line: How long will it take them to get back to the communications room?
Five minutes, maybe ten. Why?
That's how long we've got to get rid of our friend here, fix that alarm system and get back into the refinery.
But how? He'll blast us as soon as we break cover.
Yes, I'm well aware of that.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Then Sarah arrives, creating a handy distraction.

Dialogue.Line: Don't shoot! No, I

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Gebek smashes a large rock down on the Warrior's head.

Dialogue.Line: Gebek! Oh, Doctor! Oh, you're alive! I thought you'd been blown up in the cave.
Luckily for me, that was Ettis.
I don't know. Can't you ever stay out of trouble?
My dear Sarah, there's nothing I like more than a quiet life. Now if you'll excuse me, I've got something very important to do in a very short space of time. Look, can you get him out of the light?
Yes!
Yes, Doctor. We'll take him.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sarah and Gebek drag the Ice Warrior away. Meanwhile, Eckersley and Azaxyr enter the Citadel.
Alpha watches the Doctor open the wall box and start working on the door circuits.

Dialogue.Line: Ambassador! What are you doing here?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Alpha switches off the monitor.

Dialogue.Line: I was told you had taken refuge in the mines.
Nonsense. I was simply trying to keep out of the way.
Yes, but why here? Could it be that you are trying to send a message to the Federation? The spatial distress beacon!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He turns it off.

Dialogue.Line: You have been very foolish, Ambassador.
I merely thought that things were getting out of control, it would be wise to summon more help for you.
But things are not getting out of control, Ambassador. This planet is firmly under my command. If you disobey me again, Ambassador, you will take the consequences!
Now, Commander, I'm sure the Ambassador meant it for the best.
Very well, Eckersley. I will give you one more chance, Ambassador. You will come with me to the throne room. Now!
How's it going?
Nearly finished.
I'll catch you up. I forgot to switch the alarm on.
Right, that's the alarm fixed. Now for the door.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Eckersley switches on the refinery alarm system and leaves the communications room.

Dialogue.Line: Trisilicate production will be resumed immediately, your Majesty, using all available modern tools. I shall expect your Majesty's full cooperation.
When my father signed treaties with the Federation, he could not have known it would lead to nothing but bloodshed. However, we must accept the consequences.
A wise attitude, your Majesty.
Do not believe him, your Majesty! The Federation has no part in this! Commander Azaxyr is a traitor. Eckersley, too! They plan to ship the trisilicate to our enemies of Galaxy Five!
You were warned, Ambassador! Sskel!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sskel raises his weapon.

Dialogue.Line: No!
No. No, no. Whatever he knows, we still need him.
Thank you, Eckersley, but you are still a traitor.
Then this is true, Eckersley?
Yes, your Majesty, it's true. But it doesn't make any difference to you, does it?
Peladon has never dishonoured a treaty. Our loyalty is to the Federation.
There is your loyalty.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sskel aims his weapon at Thalira.

Dialogue.Line: You will obey or perish.
Now, Ambassador, you must be a lot brighter than you look. How come you're so well informed?
You were betrayed by your own security system, Eckersley.
What?
When you were conspiring with the Commander, Sarah and I overheard you on the monitor.
Sarah?
The girl! You said she had joined the rebels in the mines. Where is she? Where is she, Ambassador? You will answer if you value your life.
She left before you arrived. When she saw the Doctor on the monitor, she went to the refinery.
The Doctor!
The refinery!
Sskel, go to the refinery at once. If the Doctor is there, destroy him.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor finishes his rewiring job, and red and yellow lights start flashing.

Dialogue.Line: Right, that's it. In you go. (Gebek and Sarah enter the refinery as the Doctor closes up the box again.)
Right, the first thing we've got to do is switch the ventilation back on, and give those miners of yours some air.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He pulls down a large lever on the ventilation control console.

Dialogue.Line: There, that should do it.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sarah uncovers the statue.

Dialogue.Line: How about this, Doctor?
Yes, I've seen it.
Well, what's that thing, then?
Mmm?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor sits at the weapon console.

Dialogue.Line: That thing. What is it?
Oh, that's just a simple matter projector, linked to a directional heat ray. The projector sends an image of that, and the heat ray does the damage.
The appearances of Aggedor were all done from here?
Yes, that's right. By Eckersley or one of his Ice Warrior friends. Very clever piece of work this. Quite an engineer, our friend Eckersley.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sskel arrives outside and finds the fallen Ice Warrior. He uses his weapon on the metal door.

Dialogue.Line: Directional coordinates are here.
Something's burning. Doctor, look!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A spot of red has appeared on the inside of the metal door.

Dialogue.Line: What puzzles me, Eckersley, is your reason for this betrayal.
It's simply a matter of business, Ambassador. I'll get a percentage of all the trisilicate mined on Peladon, just to make me the richest and the most powerful man in the galaxy.
Most powerful?
Yes, your Majesty. When the Ice Warriors have won, I shall be ruler of Earth.
And what of Commander Azaxyr?
No, it's only military glory he's after.
But the Ice Warriors have been loyal members of the Federation for many years.
Azaxyr's head of some kind of breakaway group. He wants to return to the good old days of death or glory.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Azaxyr enters.

Dialogue.Line: Ah, Commander.
It appears that the Doctor is indeed alive, but Sskel has him trapped in the refinery.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Two more Ice Warriors arrive.

Dialogue.Line: Help me.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The three weapons melt the outer skin of the door quite quickly.

Dialogue.Line: Right, keep your fingers crossed. Here goes.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sarah crosses her fingers, the Doctor pulls the levers and the statue disappears from its alcove. It reappear outside the refinery, where its heat ray melts two Ice Warriors. Sskel runs away and Aggedor returns home.

Dialogue.Line: It worked! You've done it, Doctor!
Congratulations, Doctor,
They've gone!
They've all gone.
Right, we've got a chance to win now. Gebek, get back to the mines and rally your men.
Oh, I can try, Doctor, but many of them have been killed. They think Aggedor's turned against them.
Well, we'll have to make them think differently, won't we?
Well, how?
My dear chap, it's perfectly simple. Now all we have to do is to arrange a time and a place between us in advance. Then get all your men together.
Commander Azaxyr.
Ah, Sskel. Your Majesty, the Doctor has been destroyed.
No, he is still in the refinery.
Alive? What happened?
He used Aggedor as a weapon against us.
I shall send more Ice Warriors.
We cannot approach the area. The heat from the monster will destroy us.
Don't worry, Commander. I'll get him out for you. I built that refinery. It's got one or two tricks the Doctor doesn't know about. Come on.
Guard them.
How can we fight on, Gebek? Aggedor's turned against us.
No, you are mistaken.
He has slain us! He drove us into the guns of Azaxyr's warriors.
That was trickery by our enemies. Aggedor fights for us, protects the people of Peladon as he has always done. You don't believe me?
No.
Then I will show you. Now, watch.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Gebek stands on a rock and points forward down the tunnel.
The Doctor checks his watch.

Dialogue.Line: Well, I hope Gebek's timing's right. Just about now, I think.
Well, Gebek? Why do we wait?
Have patience. Have patience. MINER 2: Come on.
Look!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The statue appears.

Dialogue.Line: Do not be afraid. Aggedor will not harm us. He destroys only our enemies.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The statue vanishes.

Dialogue.Line: Now, lads, will you fight?
Yes! Yes!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Eckersley and Azaxyr watch on the monitor.

Dialogue.Line: Looks pretty nasty, doesn't it?
Don't worry. My warriors will soon destroy those primitives.
Not while those primitives have got Aggedor working for them. Time for a word with the Doctor, I think.
Well, how did you know where to send it?
Oh, there are preset coordinates for almost everywhere. Eckersley's worked it out very well.
Thanks for the compliment, Doctor.
He must be in the communications room.
That's right. You can't see me, but I can see you.
Ah. Then you must know that I'm in complete control of Aggedor. So may I suggest that you give yourself up straight away?
No, I admire you, Doctor, I really do. But you're the one who's going to have to give himself up.
What's he talking about?
Ah, he's just bluffing.
Oh no, I'm not. Remember my little security system? It works inside as well as out.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: And so it does.

Dialogue.Line: Now, that's just the lowest level, Doctor.
Surrender now, or I'll step it up.
Sarah, get out of here straight away. Warn Gebek. They're probably waiting for him. I'll try and help out with Aggedor.
Well, you can't mean to stay in here?
Oh, this sort of nonsense doesn't worry me. You know that.
No, I can't leave you in here!
Sarah, please, go.
Oh!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sarah leaves.

Dialogue.Line: He won't be able to stand very much more of that. He'll surrender soon, or collapse.
Excellent. I shall go and prepare my warriors for the attack.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Azaxyr leaves.

Dialogue.Line: Well, Doctor? Escape with the girl while you've still got a chance. And don't try sending Aggedor up here. The communication room is shielded.
Sorry, old chap, I can't stop and talk now. I'm rather busy.
Obstinate devil.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Eckersley increases the intensity of the security system, but the Doctor finishes his work and pulls the levers. Meanwhile, Sarah nearly runs into an Ice Warrior pacing up and down a tunnel. She manages to sneak past while his back is turned.

Dialogue.Line: This way.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Gebek is leading the miners when they also come across an Ice Warrior. Then the statue appears and destroys it.

Dialogue.Line: Now do you believe that Aggedor is with us?
Aye!
Come on!
The Doctor is still using Aggedor to attack us in the mines!
I know.
My warriors are being destroyed. You must stop him!
This is your last chance, Doctor. Surrender now or I'll step it up to maximum. Your brain will be totally destroyed.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor grits his teeth and manages to bear it.

Dialogue.Line: He is still resisting.
It won't be long now. He'll keel over any minute.
Commander, the miners are almost at the Citadel.
Keep up the pressure, Eckersley. I shall prepare an ambush.
There. There. (Two Ice Warriors take up the positions indicated, and Azaxyr moves further along the corridor before taking position behind a column.)

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Gebek and the miners are at the entrance to the Citadel.

Dialogue.Line: (sotto) Now, you understand? First we will make sure the Queen is safe, then we capture the aliens. And remember, Aggedor is with us. MINERS: Right.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Gebek opens the secret door.

Dialogue.Line: Come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The miners go down the apparently empty corridor, past the hidden Azaxyr.

Dialogue.Line: Destroy them!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A miner and a guard die.

Dialogue.Line: Back! Back!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Gebek and the others go back into the tunnel. Meanwhile, the Doctor sends Aggedor off again to kill Azaxyr's two Ice Warriors in the corridor. The Ice Lord escapes.

Dialogue.Line: Come on! Aggedor fights for us!
On! On to the throne room!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor finally succumbs to the security device. Sarah reaches the Citadel and takes a weapon from the dead guard.

Dialogue.Line: Turn it off!
You wouldn't use that.
Wouldn't I? Turn that alarm off.
Okay, okay. It's served its purpose anyway. The Doctor's dead.
I don't believe you.
Well, have a look.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sarah keeps the weapon pointed at the back of Eckersley's head, but when she glances at the monitor he takes it off her.

Dialogue.Line: I had a nice little scheme going until you two arrived! I ought to. Turn round. Put your hands up.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: There is a sudden noise. Sarah gasps, then realises that Eckersley has gone. She tries to open the doors.

Dialogue.Line: Oh! Open this door! Let me out!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: On the monitor, the Doctor is very still.
Eckersley avoids Gebek leading a troop of guards and miners, but a laggard nearly runs into him.

Dialogue.Line: Engineer Eckersley! Gebek has given orders for your capture.
Get out of my way.
No, you are my prisoner.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The miner draws his sword. Eckersley produces the hand weapon and kills him.

Dialogue.Line: Sorry, chum. Too much to do.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Gebek and company burst in, to see Azaxyr holding his weapon to Thalira's head.

Dialogue.Line: Surrender, Gebek. Tell your men to lay down their arms, or the Queen will die.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They obey.

Dialogue.Line: Very sensible, Gebek.
It seems we had no choice, Commander.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Gebek walks towards Azaxyr, and a guard runs for the Ice Warrior. The guard is killed, but Gebek and the miners have grabbed Azaxyr's arms, and Gebek uses Azaxyr's own weapon to kill the Warrior.

Dialogue.Line: Kill him!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Finally, Azaxyr throws off the miners.

Dialogue.Line: Now that's enough!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A guard stabs him.

Dialogue.Line: Are you harmed, your Majesty?
No, Gebek. Ambassador?
Your Majesty?
I think you should try to contact the Federation as soon as possible to inform them of our situation.
At once, your Majesty.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sarah has her head on the console desk.

Dialogue.Line: Sarah! I wondered where you'd got to. Good news! The Ice Warriors are defeated and Azaxyr is dead.
Fine.
What's wrong?
Eckersley killed the Doctor.
What? Are you sure?
Take a look. I'm going down there.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sarah goes into the tunnels, not bothering to shut the 'secret' door behind her.
The bodies are removed. Eckersley is hiding behind a tapestry in the corridor.

Dialogue.Line: I find it hard to believe that Eckersley could do something so wicked.
He had nothing to lose, your Majesty, and he's totally ruthless. We must not forget that he is still at liberty.
All right, your Majesty! You're coming with me.
Eckersley! What is the purpose of this outrage?
I've got a space shuttle hidden on the other side of the mountain. Her Majesty here is going to be my safe conduct.
I shall summon assistance. Help! Guards!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Eckersley pistol whips Alpha, then turns to see Thalira about to disappear behind a tapestry.

Dialogue.Line: Stay there, your Majesty! Don't move.
Yes, we'll go this way. Come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Sarah looks through the hole in the door then enters. The Doctor is motionless in the chair. Just as she leans over him, crying, he opens his eyes.

Dialogue.Line: Oh!
Tears?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor wipes moisture from his face.

Dialogue.Line: Anyone would think you thought I was dead.
Well, of course I did. You looked dead.
Well, even I couldn't stand the row from Eckersley's patent alarm system any longer, so I put myself into a complete sensory withdrawal.
What?
Well, a sort of trance. I shut myself off.
You did it on purpose? You mean I had all that worry for nothing!
Well, don't sound so aggrieved. Anybody would think you prefer me dead. Come on, let's go and find the others.
Alpha Centauri! Well, what happened? Where is the Queen?
This way, your Majesty! Come on!
Doctor! Thank goodness you've come. Eckersley has kidnapped the Queen.
What?
Come on! Come on!
No!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor looks into the secret tunnel.

Dialogue.Line: How well does Eckersley know these tunnels?
He made a most thorough survey when he first arrived.
It won't be easy to find him, Doctor. The mountain's riddled with these tunnels. Even the miners don't know them all.
He must have quite a start on us, too.
We could search for days and never find them.
Yeah, well, don't worry. I think I know a way we can track him down.
Come on! Quickly! Go on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: He drags her past the bodies of Ice Warriors and miners.

Dialogue.Line: Come on!
Look! Look what you've done!
Never mind.
No!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Meanwhile, the Doctor has got the real Aggedor from the pit and is using him as a bloodhound. Gebek, Sarah and some miners and guards follow. Eckersley drags Thalira into a dead end.

Dialogue.Line: We're trapped.
We've come clear through the mountain. My spaceship is just on the other side.
Well then, go! We'll be well rid of you!
I still need you for a hostage. Come on.
Don't move, Eckersley.
So that's how you found me.
Oh, yes. Aggedor may be getting on a bit but he can still sniff out a trail. I'm sorry, old chap, but it's all over.
No. Unless you want a new ruler on Peladon, you'll stand still.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Thalira bites the hand around her neck. Eckersley cries out and Thalira gets away. The Doctor releases Aggedor.

Dialogue.Line: Get him!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Aggedor gets Eckersley in a powerful bear hug.

Dialogue.Line: Help me! Help me! Help me, Doctor!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Eckersley manages to fire his gun. Aggedor falls on top of him. The pair lie still. The Doctor checks Aggedor, then shakes his head.

Dialogue.Line: Once again, Peladon owes you a great debt, Doctor, just as in my father's time. But this time, I hope that you'll stay long enough for us to show our gratitude.
Yes, well, as a matter of fact, your Majesty, I
I shall want your help and your advice, Doctor.
Oh, your Majesty. You stood up to Ortron, and to Azaxyr and the Ice Warriors. You don't need anyone's help.
I shall be needing a new Chancellor. I had hoped that you might stay.
Well, I know just the man, your Majesty. Gebek.
We have the greatest admiration for Gebek, but he has no title. He's only a miner.
There's nothing only about being a miner, your Majesty, anymore there was about being a girl.
It's the man that counts, your Majesty. You can always give him a title.
It seems that all I can give you is my thanks.
Well, I shall always be grateful for the honour, your Majesty. But I'm quite certain that Gebek is the right man.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Alpha enters.

Dialogue.Line: Your Majesty!
Ambassador?
I have just heard from Federation HQ. The war is over. Once Eckersley and Azaxyr's scheme had failed, Galaxy Five became most anxious to negotiate a peace treaty.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Gebek enters.

Dialogue.Line: Well, that's splendid news. Splendid.
Excuse me, your Majesty. Er, Doctor, that blue box you were asking about.
Yes?
We've found it. In the third gallery off the main cavern.
Thank you, Gebek. Thank you very much. I'll go and check on it straight away. With your Majesty's permission?
Of course, Doctor. Goodbye, Doctor.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor and Sarah turn and bow deeply, then leave.

Dialogue.Line: Gebek.
Your Majesty?
You're sure you don't want to stay and take the job, Doctor? Civil service post with a pension.
In you get, Sarah. I think it's time I took you home.
I mean, I'd hate to stand in the way of your career.
In you go!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor pulls Sarah into the Tardis by her ear, and it dematerialises.
